content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Accessibility Tree with numerical label representing information about the page, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
4) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {Accessibility Tree of a web page}

Now given a task: For Non-English submissions, do I need to provide a multi-language abstract, if need, answer the separator between the multiple abstracts.  Please interact with https://arxiv.org/ and get the answer.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to find submission policy. Click Help.
Action: Click [152]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open the "Non-English submissions" FAQ page for details.
Action: Click [2221]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Scroll down to bring the “Non‑English submissions” link into view before clicking.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Non‑English submissions” link with label 2221 is listed in the Policies navigation; click it to open the FAQ page.
Action: Click [2221]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Non‑English submissions” link might not yet be in the visible viewport; scrolling further down should bring it into view so that I can click it.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Non‑English submissions” link is present with numerical label 2221; opening it will give the needed policy details.
Action: Click [2221]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Non‑English submissions” link is in the Policies section but might still be outside the visible area; scrolling further down should bring it fully into view so it can be clicked.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to bring the “Policies” navigation area (elements 4028‑2224) fully into the viewport before clicking the “Non‑English submissions” link.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The link “Non‑English submissions” (numerical label 2221) is present in the Policies navigation; opening it should display the required guideline.
Action: Click [2221]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to ensure the “Non‑English submissions” link is within the visible viewport before clicking; scroll down a bit more.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open the policy page via the “Non‑English submissions” link (ID 2221) that is now listed; try clicking it again.
Action: Click [2221]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Non‑English submissions” link may still be outside the visible viewport; scrolling further down will bring the Policies navigation area into view so the link becomes clickable.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Non‑English submissions” link is inside the Policies navigation but still likely below the visible area or within a collapsed section; scrolling further down should bring it into view (or reveal it) before clicking.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to bring the “Policies” section into the visible area so that I can click “Non‑English submissions”. I should keep scrolling down the main window.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Non‑English submissions” link (2221) is listed under the “Policies” navigation. I need to open it to read the guideline. Clicking it should load the FAQ page.
Action: Click [2221]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The click fails likely because the “Policies” navigation area is not currently in the visible viewport or is only partially visible. Scrolling further down should bring “Non‑English submissions” fully into view, after which clicking will succeed.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to bring the “Policies” navigation area further into the viewport so the “Non‑English submissions” link becomes practically clickable.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Non‑English submissions” link (2221) is listed inside the visible “Policies” navigation; opening it will provide the needed guidelines about abstracts.  
Action: Click [2221]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The click likely fails because the “Non‑English submissions” link is still outside the current viewport. I should scroll further toward the bottom of the page to bring that link into view before trying to click again.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Policies” section is further down the page; keep scrolling the main window until it comes into view so we can click “Non‑English submissions”.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Policies” section is near the end of the Help Contents list. I should scroll a bit further so that the “Non‑English submissions” item is definitely visible and can be clicked without failure.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Non‑English submissions” link (2221) is now in the Policies navigation and should open the page detailing abstract requirements.  
Action: Click [2221]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The click keeps failing, likely because the “Non‑English submissions” link is not actually in the visible viewport at this scroll position (we may have scrolled past it). I should scroll the main window upward to bring the Policies navigation block into view.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I’ll open the “arXiv Policies” section first (link 2208); from there I can follow the “Non‑English submissions” policy page.
Action: Click [2208]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need the “Non‑English submissions” help page; scroll farther down so the Policies navigation (with that link) appears. 
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The FAQ index likely links to the “Non‑English submissions” page, so open the “Frequently Asked Questions” page first.
Action: Click [4921]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Open the main Help index to locate the “Non‑English submissions” policy page; click “arXiv Help Contents”.
Action: Click [4914]

Observation: please analyze the accessibility tree and give the Thought and Action.
